intro: Nonatelia retosa, commonly known as the rough nonatelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Nonatelia retosa is often found in moist, shaded areas in the undergrowth of tropical forests.
